TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is an NORP national , who was born in GPE and lives in PERSON . She is represented before the Court by PERSON PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
On DATE the applicant had a road traffic accident .

On DATE the Innsbruck ORG ( Bezirkshauptmannschaft ) withdrew the applicant 's driving licence for DATE as it found that the applicant had caused an accident under the influence of alcohol and was therefore not reliable as a driver in traffic .

On DATE , ORG found that she had been driving under the influence of alcohol , contrary to sections CARDINAL § DATE CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( b ) of LAW DATE ( Straßenverkehrsordnung ) and sentenced her to a fine of ORG CARDINAL ( approximately CARDINAL € ) .
The applicant did not appeal against this decision .

On DATE ORG found the applicant guilty of causing bodily harm by negligence “ after allowing herself ... to become intoxicated ... through the consumption of alcohol , but not to an extent which excluded her responsibility ... ” .

It therefore convicted her under LAW and CARDINAL of LAW of negligently causing bodily harm under particularly dangerous conditions ( fahrlässige PERSON besonders gefährlichen ORG ) , and sentenced her to a fine of ORG CARDINAL , CARDINAL .
The applicant appealed against ORG judgment and submitted that she had already been convicted for drunken driving by ORG . ORG judgment was therefore contrary to LAW .

On DATE ORG partly granted the applicant 's appeal . It found the applicant guilty of negligently causing bodily harm and convicted her under LAW . However , it deleted the reference to the aggravating circumstances of LAW and reduced the fine to ORG CARDINAL suspended on probation . ORG held that whereas ORG , on DATE , had withdrawn the applicant 's driving licence and , on DATE , had sentenced her for driving under the influence of alcohol , ORG conviction of driving under the influence of alcohol in particularly dangerous circumstances was in breach of the principle of ne bis in idem under LAW .
On DATE PERSON ORG ( PERSON ) filed a plea of nullity for the preservation of law ( Nichtigkeitsbeschwerde zur Wahrung des Gesetzes ) .
On DATE ORG ( Oberster Gerichtshof ) quashed ORG judgment of DATE and ORG judgment of DATE .

It found that ORG had based its decision on the same facts which were considered by the ordinary courts . Thus , the applicant 's conviction by ORG constituted in principle a technical bar to prosecution ( Verfolgungshindernis ) of the applicant by the ordinary courts from the point of view of LAW No . CARDINAL . The criminal proceedings before the ordinary courts should therefore be suspended pursuant to LAW ) .

Furthermore , ORG held that the applicant 's conduct clearly fell within the jurisdiction of the ordinary courts , as it constituted a criminal offence and not an administrative offence . It referred in this regard to S. CARDINAL subsection ( CARDINAL ) ( c ) of FAC which provides that an administrative offence is not pursued when it is based on facts that constitute an offence falling within the jurisdiction of the ordinary courts . Thus , ORG had convicted the applicant although it had not been competent to do so .
On DATE the Innsbruck ORG informed ORG that the proceedings against the applicant were discontinued and the fine paid by the applicant reimbursed .
In a further statement it confirmed that the decision of DATE had been annulled .

On DATE ORG again convicted the applicant under LAW and CARDINAL of LAW of negligently causing bodily harm under particularly dangerous conditions , and sentenced her to a fine of MONEY suspended on probation . As regards the sentence the court referred to ORG judgment of DATE and the principle prohibiting a “ reformatio in peius ” of the sentence .

The applicant appealed and submitted that the proceedings were contrary to LAW as she had been convicted for drunken driving by ORG . The conditions for reopening the case under LAW No . CARDINAL were not met .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal . It noted that ORG had annulled its conviction . Thus , the temporary technical bar to prosecution ( Verfolgungshindernis ) of the applicant before the ordinary courts did no longer exist . The courts could therefore resume the proceedings in the applicant 's case which might be qualified as the re - opening of a case within the meaning of LAW No . CARDINAL .
PERSON of LAW DATE ( Straßenverkehrsordnung ) provides that it is an offence for a person to drive a vehicle under the influence of alcohol .
S. CARDINAL of the DATE Act provides , so far as relevant , that :

“ ( CARDINAL ) It shall be an administrative offence ( PERSON ) , punishable with a fine of not less than € CARDINAL and not CARDINAL or , in default of payment , with DATE imprisonment , for any person to drive a vehicle when under the influence of drink ... ”

S. CARDINAL subsection ( CARDINAL ) ( c ) of LAW provides that an administrative offence is not pursued when it is based on facts that constitute an offence falling within the jurisdiction of the ordinary courts
Under LAW of LAW ) , it is an offence , punishable by DATE imprisonment or a fine up to CARDINAL DATE - rates , to cause physical injury by negligence .
Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL increases the sentence in respect of causing injury by DATE imprisonment and CARDINAL DATE - rates , if the special circumstances of LAW § CARDINAL apply .
Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL applies where a person commits the offence “ after allowing himself , even if only negligently , to become intoxicated ... through the consumption of alcohol ... ” .
Article CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure ( GPE ) provides that criminal proceedings have to be suspended inter alia when the offender temporarily can not be prosecuted by the courts .
According to Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL proceedings have to be discontinued inter alia when prosecution is not possible .
